sectionOne.title: Our
sectionOne.description: At Steplix we work with the best technologies available on the market to make our customers' products a reality. Meet them here

cards.react: We chose the React Javascript library for the Front-End development of single page apps and PWAs since it is focused on the use of components and allows us to shorten development times.
cards.git: We use Git as a code versioning tool, applying the Feature-Branch methodology and Gitlab as a repository manager.
cards.docker: We work with Docker, an open source option that gives us the advantages of High portability, High performance, Agility, Error isolation and Scalability.
cards.next: Next. js is a framework that enables developers to build high-performance web applications through server-side rendering.
cards.flutter: We use Flutter for hybrid applications as it is an open source SDK created by Google, which allows us to develop Android, iOS interfaces and allows full customization thanks to the layered architecture.
cards.aws: Amazon AWS increases the independence of the development team and allows the implementation of a Just In Time Infrastructure scheme, in which resources are only provisioned as they are required by the project.
cards.figma: We chose Figma as a tool to design interfaces as it gives us the possibility to create advanced wireframes, interfaces and prototypes. One of its greatest benefits is that it is web-based, which allows us to store the work in a cloud and be able to access it from any device.
cards.kotlin: We develop native Android applications with Kotlin creating a more concise and expressive code. In addition, it maintains full compatibility with Java-based technologies.
cards.node: We work with NodeJS, a Javascript interpreter based on the Chrome engine that allows us to perform 100% of the Back-End tasks required. The chosen framework is ExpressJS, a minimalist and flexible yet robust and widely tested framework within the web development industry.

UI_UXDesigner.title: UX/UI DESIGNER
UI_UXDesigner.description: We are looking for a Sr. UX/UI Designer with 3/5 years of experience and a great knowledge in UX and UI design.

values.title: What does it mean to be a Steplixer UX/UI Designer?
values.textOne: Share the following values: trust, respect, adaptation, success, awareness, and agility.
values.textTwo: And also that it presents solutions through design, that is why it is important that you have very good aesthetic criteria and be super demanding with this aspect.

requirements.title: What are your tasks going to be?
items: Carry out discovery and research processes with your leader's company, in order to help clients and the team assigned to the project.
Understand and define the business objectives of our clients.
Define and describe who your users are and what their needs are.
Detect pain points within the customer journey in order to find opportunities.
Define what functionalities the product must have to provide value to its potential users and be able to go to market as soon as possible.
Organize the information flows within the product so that it is intuitively accessible.
Achieve a user experience that meets business objectives, friendly and high quality in conjunction with the team.

Get involved in the business problem that the client wants to solve and with the market in which it operates in order to interpret its needs and thus be able to design a digital product that solves a real problem, is easy to use and makes a difference from the aesthetic.

You will have to work side by side with the entire Steplixers team assigned to the project you are working on, so that the design meets the functional requirements of the product, and that the development team can implement it in a timely manner.

responsibilities.title: What do we expect from you?
responsibilities.subtitle: You need to have experience and knowledge in:
items: Rapid prototyping.
High definition mockups.
Presentation of solutions and argumentation.
Knowledge of good practices and usability patterns both in mobile as website.
Experience in design processes.
Experience in user research and user testing.
Facilitation of Design Thinking, Design Sprint Workshops, etc.
Knowledge of Sketch, Figma or Adobe XD Miro or Mural.
Be detailed, independent and proactive.

valueOne.title: Trust
valueOne.text: It is the faith in the contribution of the other, it is giving certainty that we will fulfill our commitments with others. It is not failing the other or ourselves.

valueTwo.title: Mutual respect
valueTwo.text: It is communicating with honesty and empathy, giving the other the opportunity to express their doubts and disagreements, trusting that they always seek to add value. It is to avoid wasting our time, the group, making excuses or talking unnecessarily.

valueThree.title: Success
valueThree.text: It is the satisfaction of our customers. It is obtained by showing attitude, initiative and proactivity, resilience, solving problems and seeking to stand out, both in our solutions and in the teams that we make up. It's growing all the time, personally and professionally.

valueFour.title: Agility
valueFour.text: It is adapting to situations, changes and challenges, seeking practicality, learning from mistakes and applying continuous improvement. It's avoiding rigidity, being stubborn or standing still.

valueFive.title: Conscience
valueFive.text: It is the ability to recognize the surrounding reality. It is to promote sustainability, empathy and diversity. It is to influence from our coherence, integrity and honesty. It is recognizing the need to live honoring respect, balance and equity. It is to avoid discrimination, aggression and malice.

scrumFramework.titleOne: Did you know that we work under the

paragraphOne.textOne: At Steplix we use the Scrum framework, which is based on iterative/incremental development that allows us to deliver value from the beginning of the project and all along the construction of the product, guaranteeing adjustments in design and development at opportune moments of the life cycle. We form a multidisciplinary team, called
paragraphOne.textTwo: , that will be supported by a servant leader under the role of
paragraphOne.textThree: . All collaborators have the necessary technical knowledge. It should be noted that the participation of the client is key and necessary, through a representative that he designates under the role of
paragraphOne.textFour: to ensure fluid and adequate communication of the requirements.

paragraphTwo.textOne: The Scrum framework is made up of a series of events/meetings that take place at strategic times, during 2-week cycles (
paragraphTwo.textTwo: ) where work is done based on certain requirements selected from the main surveyed/prioritized list (
paragraphTwo.textThree: ), which results from a planning meeting that gives origin to the list of requirements to be built during those two weeks (
paragraphTwo.textFour: ) and are developed guaranteeing a functional deliverable (
paragraphTwo.textFive: )  at the end of each Sprint. Every two weeks, at the end of each iteration, the product increment is presented, tested and discussed with the customer for evaluation in a meeting held by the team together with the Product Owner. The team meets daily to maintain alignment with the goal of the current Sprint and at the end of the iteration the Scrum Team holds a retrospective meeting to assess how they have been working and apply continuous improvement to their development processes and practices.

scrumFramework.subtitle: This type of framework allows us:
items: Manage the expectations of our clients based on tangible results, which are available from the beginning of the project.
Improve time to market.
Flexibility and adaptation to customer needs, changes in the market, etc.
Systematic management of the Return on Investment.
